intro: Henckelia angusta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved henckelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and ixora. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests.
